definition: to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread

sentences.english: Jane stood froze from head to toe and watched the car accelerate down the street.
sentences.chinese: 简一动不动地站在那儿，看着那辆车沿街急驰而去。

sentences.english: The cart and fruit were overthrown by a speeding car.
sentences.chinese: 手推车和水果被一辆急驰而过的汽车撞翻了。

sentences.english: The police car raced through the streets in pursuit of the stolen motorbike.
sentences.chinese: 警车在街上急驰，追赶着那辆被盗的摩托车。

sentences.english: Then the man drove away, apparently in a great hurry.
sentences.chinese: 然后，劫车人迫不及待地急驰而去。

sentences.english: The car sped along the highway.
The racing car powered down the home straight.
sentences.chinese: 赛车在终点直道上急驰。

sentences.english: I looked out of the window and caught sight of a quickly passing train.
sentences.chinese: 我从窗户向外看去，看见了一列急驰而过的火车。

sentences.english: As the car race past, it spatter mud on my clothes.
sentences.chinese: 当汽车急驰而过时，它将烂泥溅在我衣服上。

sentences.english: Jane stood frozen from head to toe and watched the car accelerate down the street.
sentences.chinese: 简一动不动地站在那儿，看着那辆车沿街急驰而去。

sentences.english: An adjutant galloped down the street, followed by a Cossack.
sentences.chinese: 一个副官带着一名哥萨克从街上急驰而过。

sentences.english: At the same time the soldiers put spurs to their horses.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，战士们策马急驰。

definition: to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
to whistle past/to hurtle past/to zip by
